meanings.definition: The quality or state of being commensurable.
meanings.sent1: The commensurabilities of the shapes made it easy to compare them.
meanings.sent2: The commensurabilities of the ingredients in the recipe allowed for easy substitutions.
meanings.sent3: The commensurabilities of the puzzle pieces made it a breeze to put together.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity had a commensurability that touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The commensurabilities of the colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.

meanings.definition: The ability to be measured or compared in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: The commensurabilities of the lengths made it simple to find the longest one.
meanings.sent2: The commensurabilities of the prices helped us decide which option was the best value.
meanings.sent3: The commensurabilities of the animals' sizes in the zoo made for an interesting comparison.
meanings.sent4: The commensurabilities of their skills on the field determined the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent5: The commensurabilities of the students' progress were evident in their test scores.
